messages.message: Is it possible to find out why this didn’t work in build? Using the new data types feature and trying to run a clean function on a table.
can you send the har file?

For table type, the "clean" if it's about column or row filtering should also be done through TDF instead of raw LLM -- cc @Varun Jain @Hari @Rakesh @lydia here -- please work with the Build team what's a good design here. As I stress many times -- TDF's primary usage is in Build's extraction mode, so how TDF & Build's table type extraction interaction are designed need to be in lock step
What is TDF?
the table detection framework, it's an internal eng term sorry not exposed to the user
ah cool, seen it a few times and wasn’t sure what it was.
it's how we bypass LLM's context window to solve long table problems
I didn’t raise a ticket here as its in preview, would you like one to track this?
Thanks - we'll address this. I assume the issue if the table is too long?
there's a ticket. let me link it here
https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1460
@Lee can you include your sample doc here? That way we can also confirm it's fixed

yeah there should be already an initiative. thank you -- @lydia i think how cleaning works for tables in general should be done in TDF; might be good to connect with Rakesh and Hari on what might be a best approach, i can also join the discussion to brainstorm
using raw LLM you might get incorrect formatting or extra words etc
basically all the limitations we had before TDF was available came back after raw LLM cleaning

Thanks all, yep 2 secs and i’ll get the doc.

I also opened another small bug , which I assume is caused by the same pipeline, we’re converting number strings to floats making extracted currencies not have the trailing 0's

https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1646
yeah i saw that, its a good point
On second thoughts, is this so we can add that column up deterministically as its stored as a number and not a string?
it is caused by how we store this column as a number column -- this enables further sorting and filtering to get for example, only transactions more than X
The data type conversion issues are being addressed. We will have these improvements go in the next release. Will look into if we back port as well!
Thanks @Hari this is under a feature flag, so not a problem for current releases, I was just playing with it to test out a new use case
